Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
splt - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: SPLT Process
Screen.Label: Section PLoT Process
Plot a section of seismic traces.
TIME=
IPS=
TPI=
LRRL=
NUM_TR=
CT=
CS_SID=

Help.Tip: Maximum trace time to plot (time at bottom of plotted trace).
Help.Text:
splt - TIME
Maximum trace time to plot (time at bottom of plotted trace).
 
 Default = Time on job data screen
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 TIME*IPS + SDAS cannot exceed the maximum plot height.  Maximum plot height
 is 30 inches for HP and 40 inches for HP5000A.

Help.Tip: Vertical trace scaling - increment (in. or cm) per second.
Help.Text:
splt - IPS
Vertical trace scaling - increment (in. or cm) per second.
 
 Default = 5.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 The maximum value of IPS is
 
         (number of samples per second)*(65535+0.01)/(RES*4096.0),
 
 where RES is the resolution (either 200 or 400 dots per inch).

Help.Tip: Lateral trace spacing - traces per increment (in. or cm).
Help.Text:
splt - TPI
Lateral trace spacing - traces per increment (in. or cm).
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 TPI cannot be less than 2.0 traces per inch.
 TPI cannot exceed 0.5*(plot resolution).

Help.Tip: Plot traces left to right (LR) or right to left (RL).
Help.Text:
splt - LRRL
Plot traces left to right (LR) or right to left (RL).
 
 Default = RL
 Allowed = LR, RL

Help.Tip: Maximum number of traces to plot.
Help.Text:
splt - NUM_TR
Maximum number of traces to plot.
 
 Default = 100
 Allowed = 12000 >= int > 0
 NUM_TR/TPI cannot exceed the maximum plot length.  Maximum plot length is 240
 inches for INDIGO and 200 inches for CONPLOT.

Help.Tip: Plotting gain - LAV is plotted as CT channels.
Help.Text:
splt - CT
Plotting gain - LAV is plotted as CT channels.
 
 Default = 5.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 The largest absolute value (LAV) is plotted as CT/2 channels, where a channel
 is the plotted lateral trace spacing.  (Since it is presumed that the sample
 with the LAV is near another with similar amplitude and opposite polarity,
 the pair plot as CT channels.)

Help.Tip: Plot annotation text fields (Section IDentification).
Help.Text:
splt - SID
Plot annotation text fields (Section IDentification).
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char(40) array of 4
 The characters ", = * ( )" cannot be used in a SID entry.  An array of four
 identical SID fields is provided.

Help.Tip: Character size for SID, in inches or cm.
Help.Text:
splt - CS_SID
Character size for SID, in inches or cm.
 
 Default = 0.27 inch
 Allowed = less than 1 inch.

Help.Tip: Lateral distance scale marker (mile or kilometer marker).
Help.Text:
splt - SCALE
Lateral distance scale marker (mile or kilometer marker).
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO or real
 SCALE = YES plots a mile or kilometer marker above the trace plot using the
 difference between header word 17 values of the first two traces to determine
 the size of the marker.
 SCALE = NO doesn't plot distance scale marker.
 SCALE = a number interprets the number as the difference between header word
 17 values of two adjacent traces (in feet or meters).

Help.Tip: Character size for SCALE, in inches or cm.
Help.Text:
splt - CS_SCALE
Character size for SCALE, in inches or cm.
 
 Default = 0.13 inch
 Allowed = Less than 1 inch.

Help.Tip: Header word to plot as a trace label above section.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_LAB
Header word to plot as a trace label above section.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 0 - NWIH, array of 4
 Four automatic trace labels are allowed, HDR_LAB(1) - HDR_LAB(4).  Label(1) is
 plotted nearest the trace plot and labels(2-4) are stacked sequentially above
 label(1).
 If any of HDR_LAB(1-4)=0, do not plot that label.

Help.Tip: Name to plot adjacent to automatic or manual trace labels.
Help.Text:
splt - NAM_LAB
Name to plot adjacent to automatic or manual trace labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char(16) array of 4
 NAM_LAB is an array of names to plot adjacent to automatic or manual trace
 labels to identify them.  The array has an element for each of the four
 labels.

Help.Tip: Character size for trace label(A-D), in inches or cm.
Help.Text:
splt - CS_LAB
Character size for trace label(A-D), in inches or cm.
 
 Default = 0.13 inch
 Allowed = real > 0.0 array of 2

Help.Tip: Trace number for the first automatic trace label.
Help.Text:
splt - LAB_INIT
Trace number for the first automatic trace label.
 
 Default = 50
 Allowed = int (1 to NUM_TR)
 Allowed = SHOT
 Allowed = HDR
 If LAB_INIT = an integer, the first automatic trace label will be plotted
 above that trace number.
 If LAB_INIT = SHOT, HDR_LAB(1) must be zero and HDR_LAB(2) labels are plotted
 above manual shotpoint labels.
 If LAB_INIT = HDR, the HDR_LAB(1) label is plotted above the first trace and
 subsequently wherever the header word HDR_CHG changes.

Help.Tip: Plot automatic trace labels wherever HDR_CHG changes.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_CHG
Plot automatic trace labels wherever HDR_CHG changes.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 Active only if LAB_INIT = HDR.

Help.Tip: Trace number increment between automatic trace labels.
Help.Text:
splt - LAB_INC
Trace number increment between automatic trace labels.
 
 Default = 50
 Allowed = int > 0
 LAB_INIT and LAB_INC have the same function on each panel if the panel option
 is chosen, i.e. the pattern starts over for each new panel.

Help.Tip: Manual shot point labels
Help.Text:
splt - TRCE
Manual shot point labels
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int linked array(50)
 Trace number to shart shot point label.
 Numbers may range from 1 to NUM_TR

Help.Tip: Manual shot point labels
Help.Text:
splt - SHOT
Manual shot point labels
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char linked array(50)
 First shot point to label
 8 characters may be used per shot.  Do not use , = ( ) or *.

Help.Tip: Manual shot point labels.
Help.Text:
splt - INTV
Manual shot point labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The number of trace intervals between shot point labels.

Help.Tip: Manual shot point labels.
Help.Text:
splt - INCR
Manual shot point labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The shot point increment to the next label.

Help.Tip: Manual shot point labels.
Help.Text:
splt - TOTL
Manual shot point labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The total number of shot points to do.

Help.Tip: Manual shot tic marks
Help.Text:
splt - TRTIC
Manual shot tic marks
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The trace number to start shot point tics.

Help.Tip: Manual shot tic marks.
Help.Text:
splt - INTIC
Manual shot tic marks.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The number of trace intervals between shot point tics.

Help.Tip: Manual shot tic marks.
Help.Text:
splt - ITTIC
Manual shot tic marks.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The total number of tics to do.

Help.Tip: Plot automatic or manual trace labels on top and bottom of plot.
Help.Text:
splt - LTAB
Plot automatic or manual trace labels on top and bottom of plot.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO
 If LTAB = NO, then plot labels on top of section only.

Help.Tip: Plot vertical lines, blanks or timing marks under labels.
Help.Text:
splt - OPT_VL
Plot vertical lines, blanks or timing marks under labels.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES  (Plot a vertical line under the trace labels.)
 Allowed = NO   (No marking under the trace labels.)
 Allowed = BTL  (Blank the Timing Lines under the trace labels.)
 Allowed = TM   (Plot 10 mil Timing Marks under the trace labels.)

Help.Tip: Width of vertical lines under labels, in inches or cm.
Help.Text:
splt - WID_VL
Width of vertical lines under labels, in inches or cm.
 
 Default = 0.005 inch
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 The front-end will insure that WID_VL is at least one dot larger than the WT
 parameter.

Help.Tip: Label for the arrow pointing toward the start of the plot.
Help.Text:
splt - AR_BEG
Label for the arrow pointing toward the start of the plot.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char(3)
 Normally strings such as N, S, SE are used. If AR_BEG = BLANK, no arrow is
 plotted.

Help.Tip: Label for the arrow pointing toward the end of the plot.
Help.Text:
splt - AR_END
Label for the arrow pointing toward the end of the plot.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char(3)
 Normally strings such as N, S, SE are used.  If AR_END = BLANK, no arrow is
 plotted.

Help.Tip: Height of the direction arrow head.
Help.Text:
splt - AR_HT
Height of the direction arrow head.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 If AR_HT = 0.0, then arrow head height will be calculated as 0.035 * IPS.

Help.Tip: Length of the direction arrow.
Help.Text:
splt - AR_LEN
Length of the direction arrow.
 
 Default = 2.5
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Typical values are 2.5 inches or 6.35 cm.

Help.Tip: Pathname for file containing the automatic title block master.
Help.Text:
splt - PATH_ATBM
Pathname for file containing the automatic title block master.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char
 If PATH_ATBM is non-blank and the filename has the extension .atbm, SPLT will
 automatically plot a title block based on the history file and the automatic
 title block master file.  If the extension is not .atbm, the contents of the
 file will be plotted as text in the title block space.

Help.Tip: Factor for reducing the title block size.
Help.Text:
splt - FRTB
Factor for reducing the title block size.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = 1.0 >= real > 0.0
 If your title block is too long to be plotted, SPLT will automatically reduce
 the size to avoid running off the bottom of the plot.

Help.Tip: Local device to use for plotting.
Help.Text:
splt - DEV_LOC
Local device to use for plotting.
 
 Default = HP5000A (HP5000 plotter 2nd floor lobo)
 Allowed = HP      (HP     plotter 3rd floor lobo)
 Allowed = TEST    (Run SPLT but write .rpt file only and don't make a plot.)
 Allowed = SAVECGM (Save a CGM file in current directory; do not plot.)

Help.Tip: Quality for HP5000 plots.
Help.Text:
splt - QUALITY
Quality for HP5000 plots.
 
 Default = PROD
 Allowed = PROD
 Allowed = MAX
 Allowed = FAST
 Active only if DEV_LOC = HP5000. PROD = production quality, normal speed.
 MAX = Maximum quality, slowest speed.  FAST = poorest quality, fast speed.

Help.Tip: Options for local Versatec A or B plotters.
Help.Text:
splt - OPT_DEV
Options for local Versatec A or B plotters.
 
 Default = PAPER
 Allowed = PAPER
 Allowed = FILM
 Active only if DEV_LOC = HP5000.

Help.Tip: Number of copies to make of this plot.
Help.Text:
splt - COPIES
Number of copies to make of this plot.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = 1 - 99

Help.Tip: Processor or technician initials for plot identification.
Help.Text:
splt - INIT
Processor or technician initials for plot identification.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char(3)
 Initials are plotted at the end of the plot in the identification section so
 operators can determine which are your plots.

Help.Tip: Whether operators should fold this plot.
Help.Text:
splt - FOLD
Whether operators should fold this plot.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO

Help.Tip: Method to use for the calculated CT factor.
Help.Text:
splt - METH_CCT
Method to use for the calculated CT factor.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = NONE
 Allowed = MED
 Allowed = NOMED
 If METH_CCT = NONE, then use the CT parameter, do not use the calculated CT.
 
 If METH_CCT = MED, then use a calculated CT that plots the median absolute
 amplitude of the plotted traces as CCTF channels.  (CT = CCTF * LAV/MEDIAN)
 The median calculation uses only nonzero sample values below the head mute.
 
 If METH_CCT = NOMED, then use a calculated CT that plots unit amplitude of
 the plotted traces as CCTF channels.  This method assumes the traces have
 already been median scaled, i.e. scaled so that the median absolute amplitude
 is 1.0.  (CT = CCTF * LAV)

Help.Tip: Parameter to use in calculated CT factor.
Help.Text:
splt - CCTF
Parameter to use in calculated CT factor.
 
 Default = 0.35
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Recommended values are 0.35 for relative amplitude plots and 0.9 for
 structural (XP) plots.

Help.Tip: Invert plotted traces so that the last sample is plotted on top
Help.Text:
splt - NVRT
Invert plotted traces so that the last sample is plotted on top
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO

Help.Tip: Determine plotting gain using individual trace LAV or dataset LAV.
Help.Text:
splt - NORM
Determine plotting gain using individual trace LAV or dataset LAV.
 
 Default = ALL
 Allowed = ALL
 Allowed = EACH
 If NORM = ALL, then use the same gain for all traces based on the maximum LAV
 of all the plotted traces.  (Old NORM=NO.)
 If NORM = EACH, then calculate a gain for each trace individually based on
 the LAV of that trace.  (Old NORM=YES.)

Help.Tip: Number of dots to use for the wiggle trace line.
Help.Text:
splt - WT
Number of dots to use for the wiggle trace line.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = 0, 1, 2
 WT can be 0 only if VA = YES.  WT must be 1 if making dual polarity plots.

Help.Tip: Variable area option - fill in positive lobe of the wiggle trace?
Help.Text:
splt - VA
Variable area option - fill in positive lobe of the wiggle trace?
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES/NO
 If VA = NO, you will get a wiggle trace only plot.

Help.Tip: Variable area start shading option.
Help.Text:
splt - VASTRT
Variable area start shading option.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = 1.0 >= VASTRT >= 0.0
 VA shading will shade the amplitude range from VASTRT*LAV to LAV.

Help.Tip: Variable intensity option - plot every other VA raster scan?
Help.Text:
splt - VAI
Variable intensity option - plot every other VA raster scan?
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO
 If VAI = YES, every other scan will be plotted in the VA raster area so that
 overlapping trace lobes do no obliterate each other.

Help.Tip: Reverse polarity option - multiply samples by -1 before plotting.
Help.Text:
splt - RP
Reverse polarity option - multiply samples by -1 before plotting.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO

Screen.title: Trace_Selection_Parameters
Screen.Label: Trace Selection Parameters
Will use this pattern until NUM_TR (screen 1) traces are selected
SKIP_INIT=
NUM_DO=
NUM_SKIP=

Help.Tip: Number of traces to skip initially in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
splt - SKIP_INIT
Number of traces to skip initially in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int>=0
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially plotting ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until NUM_TR total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to process at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
splt - NUM_DO
Number of traces to process at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially plotting ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until NUM_TR total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to skip at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
splt - NUM_SKIP
Number of traces to skip at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int>=0
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially plotting ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until NUM_TR total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Number of traces per panel. NTPP = 0 means do not use panels.
Help.Text:
splt - NTPP
Number of traces per panel. NTPP = 0 means do not use panels.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int < NUM_TR

Help.Tip: Number of rows of panels to plot.
Help.Text:
splt - NROW
Number of rows of panels to plot.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = 1 - 26

Help.Tip: Column number of the panel you want to label.
Help.Text:
splt - PCOL
Column number of the panel you want to label.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int

Help.Tip: Row number of the panel you want to label.
Help.Text:
splt - PROW
Row number of the panel you want to label.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int

Help.Tip: Label for panel.
Help.Text:
splt - PLBL
Label for panel.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char (32)
 If PLBL begins with a period followed by a blank (. ), then that label will
 not be plotted.

Help.Tip: Panel label character size.
Help.Text:
splt - PLCS
Panel label character size.
 
 Default = 0.3
 Allowed = 0.05 - 0.3 inches
 Suggested values are 0.3 inches, 0.75 cm.

Help.Tip: Repeat trace labeling (automatic or manual) on each panel.
Help.Text:
splt - RSPP
Repeat trace labeling (automatic or manual) on each panel.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES/NO
 If RSPP = YES, then each panel is treated as a separate section.

Help.Tip: Insert blank traces when header word HDR_BT changes.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_BT
Insert blank traces when header word HDR_BT changes.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Number of blank traces to insert when header word BTHW changes.
Help.Text:
splt - BTHC
Number of blank traces to insert when header word BTHW changes.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = < NUM_TR
 If BTHC = 0, then blank traces and timing line numbers are automatically
 inserted between panels (if paneling is being done).
 If BTHC > 0, then blank traces are inserted only when header word BTHW
 changes.

Help.Tip: Number of dots to use for as many as 6 levels of timing lines.
Help.Text:
splt - TLDOTS
Number of dots to use for as many as 6 levels of timing lines.
 
 Default = 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 2
 Allowed = 0 - 4 array(6)
 A zero entered for any level causes that level to be omitted in plotting.
 
            Line Spacing       Default
       10 mil      0 dots
       50      0
       100     1
       400     0
       500     0
       1000        2

Help.Tip: Timing line character size.
Help.Text:
splt - TLCS
Timing line character size.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 If TLCS = 0.0, then character size will be 0.035*IPS.
 If TLCS = -1, then no timing lines will be plotted.

Help.Tip: Timing line starting position, in mils from top of section.
Help.Text:
splt - TLST
Timing line starting position, in mils from top of section.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = integer > 0
 Annotation will always be referenced to top of section (TSTRT).

Help.Tip: Trace number to start blanking timing lines.
Help.Text:
splt - TBST
Trace number to start blanking timing lines.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int < NUM_TR

Help.Tip: Trace number increment between blank timing lines.
Help.Text:
splt - TBIB
Trace number increment between blank timing lines.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int < 0

Help.Tip: Total number of times to blank timing lines.
Help.Text:
splt - TBTOT
Total number of times to blank timing lines.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int < 0

Help.Tip: Pathname of the file containing velocity functions to plot.
Help.Text:
splt - PATH_VEL
Pathname of the file containing velocity functions to plot.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char
 Velocity function names within the file must be distinct.

Help.Tip: Factor for reducing plotted velocity function size.
Help.Text:
splt - FRVF
Factor for reducing plotted velocity function size.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = 1.0 >= FRVF > 0.0

Help.Tip: Options for velocity function interpolation.
Help.Text:
splt - VINT
Options for velocity function interpolation.
 
 Default = TINT5
 Allowed = TINT5  (Time interpolation to 5.5 sec.)
 Allowed = TINT7  (Time interpolation to 7.0 sec.)
 Allowed = TINT15 (Time interpolation to 15.0 sec.)
 Allowed = ORI   (Original function + interpolated times every 0.5 sec. )
 Allowed = VELO   (Velocity interpolation.)
 Allowed = NONE   (Plot function without change.)

Help.Tip: Tolerance for determining equality of coordinate values.
Help.Text:
splt - VXTOL
Tolerance for determining equality of coordinate values.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 SPLT looks at the value of the velocity file coordinate header for the first
 two traces to determine whether the file should be read in increasing or
 decreasing order.  This may be difficult if the coordinate header does not
 monotonically increase or decrease.  In this case you should set VXTOL
 non-zero so that if the header value of the two traces falls within VXTOL of
 each other, SPLT will look at more traces to determine the order.

Screen.title: Block Boundaries_Tie Lines_Side Labels
Screen.Label: Block Boundaries, Tie Lines, Side Labels
PATH_BLK=~
BLCS=
PATH_TIE1=
PATH_TIE2=
TICS=
TBOT=
Block Boundaries, Tie Lines, Side Labels

Help.Tip: Pathname of file containing block boundary information.
Help.Text:
splt - PATH_BLK
Pathname of file containing block boundary information.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char
 File must be built with the BBLK utility.

Help.Tip: Block label character size.
Help.Text:
splt - BLCS
Block label character size.
 
 Default = 0.3
 Allowed = 0.05 - 0.3 inches
 Suggested size is 0.3 inches or 0.762 cm.

Help.Tip: Pathname of file containing line-tie information.
Help.Text:
splt - PATH_TIE1
Pathname of file containing line-tie information.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char
 File must be built with the BTIE utility.

Help.Tip: Pathname of the second file containing line-tie information.
Help.Text:
splt - PATH_TIE2
Pathname of the second file containing line-tie information.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char
 File must be built with the BTIE utility.  Information in this file will be
 plotted above that from PATH_TIE1.

Help.Tip: Line-tie character size.
Help.Text:
splt - TICS
Line-tie character size.
 
 Default = 0.07
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Suggested size is 0.07 inches or 0.18 cm.

Help.Tip: Plot line-tie marks on bottom of section as well as the top.
Help.Text:
splt - TBOT
Plot line-tie marks on bottom of section as well as the top.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO

Help.Tip: Trace numbers for manual line-tie labels.
Help.Text:
splt - TITR
Trace numbers for manual line-tie labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = int linked array(50)
 Manual lie-ties cannot be used if PATH_TIE is specified.

Help.Tip: Manual line-tie labels.
Help.Text:
splt - TIE
Manual line-tie labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char linked array(50)
 40 characters may be used per label.  Do not use , = ( ) or *.

Help.Tip: Manual side labels.
Help.Text:
splt - SLTIM
Manual side labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real linked array(50)
 The time in seconds to position the label.

Help.Tip: Manual side labels.
Help.Text:
splt - SLBL
Manual side labels.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = char linked array(50)
 The annotation for the side label.  24 characters available.

Help.Tip: Manual side labels.
Help.Text:
splt - SLSZ
Manual side labels.
 
 Default = .15
 Allowed = real linked array(50)
 The character size of the side label in inches or cm.  A zero here will be
 plotted at .15 inch.

Help.Tip: Manual side labels
Help.Text:
splt - SLROW
Manual side labels
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = integer linked array(50)
 The row you are labeling refers to paneled plots.  If you are not paneling
 use 1.

Help.Tip: Fold of stack indicator.
Help.Text:
splt - FLST
Fold of stack indicator.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = integer
 Plots a fold of stack indicator as an open circle between zero time and
 100 mils with 100% of FLST plotted at zero time.  FLST=maximum fold.  Zero =
 no fold of stack indicator plotted.  Fold will be plotted between the top
 of the section and the first 100 mils.

Help.Tip: Header word to use for FLST.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_FL
Header word to use for FLST.
 
 Default = 5
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 Word 5 is the fold of stack which is standard for the FLST parameter.

Help.Tip: Velocity to use for OVJD tics.
Help.Text:
splt - OVJD
Velocity to use for OVJD tics.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Plots a tic mark at time = offset/(OVJD velocity).  Used to verify field
 geometry.
 If OVJD = 0.0, then do not plot tics.

Help.Tip: Header word carrying offset to use for OVJD tics.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_OFF
Header word carrying offset to use for OVJD tics.
 
 Default = 6
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Thickness of OVJD tic marks.
Help.Text:
splt - OVWD
Thickness of OVJD tic marks.
 
 Default = 0.01 inches
 Allowed = real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Header word to use for dashed line plot.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_DL
Header word to use for dashed line plot.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 Word 19 is the elevation which would be the standard use for this parameter.

Help.Tip: Reference number to be plotted at zero time for HDR_DL
Help.Text:
splt - DLREF
Reference number to be plotted at zero time for HDR_DL
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Units representing 100 mils for HDR_DL
Help.Text:
splt - DLU100
Units representing 100 mils for HDR_DL
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Header word to use for plus sign plot.
Help.Text:
splt - HDR_PL
Header word to use for plus sign plot.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 Works the same as the HDR_DL option.

Help.Tip: Reference number to be plotted at zero time for HDR_PL
Help.Text:
splt - PLREF
Reference number to be plotted at zero time for HDR_PL
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Units representing 100 mils for HDR_PL
Help.Text:
splt - PLU100
Units representing 100 mils for HDR_PL
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Reference elevation to zero time
Help.Text:
splt - REZT
Reference elevation to zero time
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES/NO
 Reference elevation (HDR_DL and HDR_PL) and fold of stack (FLST) to zero
 time.  If there is a negative tstrt, zero time will be below the top of the
 section.  REZT=NO will reference elevation and flst to the top of the section
 rather than zero.

Help.Tip: Plot midpoint surface elevation in box above section?
Help.Text:
splt - PMSE
Plot midpoint surface elevation in box above section?
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO

Help.Tip: Units representing 100 mils for PMSE
Help.Text:
splt - PMSE100
Units representing 100 mils for PMSE
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = 1.0 to 1000.0

Help.Tip: Automatic calculation of annotation location above section.
Help.Text:
splt - CALD
Automatic calculation of annotation location above section.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES, NO, YREV
 If CALD = YES, SPLT calculates the location of annotation elements above the
 section automatically.
 If CALD = NO, you will be prompted for individual location values.
 If CALD = YREV, you must review the values SPLT calculates automatically.
 
 You cannot exit the front-end until CALD has been set to YES or NO.

Help.Tip: Distance above zero time to plot the first SID line (in. or cm).
Help.Text:
splt - SDAS
Distance above zero time to plot the first SID line (in. or cm).
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Active if CALD = NO.

Help.Tip: Distance of scale above the section.
Help.Text:
splt - SCDA
Distance of scale above the section.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Active if CALD = NO.

Help.Tip: Distance above the section to plot the line tie (in. or cm).
Help.Text:
splt - TIDA
Distance above the section to plot the line tie (in. or cm).
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real >= 0.1 inch
 Active if CALD = NO.

Help.Tip: Distance of the direction arrow above the section.
Help.Text:
splt - ARDA
Distance of the direction arrow above the section.
 
 Default = 2.5
 Allowed = real > 0.1 inch
 Typical values are 2.5 (English) or 6.35 (metric).
 Active if CALD = NO.

Help.Tip: Distance of the survace elevation plot above the section.
Help.Text:
splt - SEDA
Distance of the survace elevation plot above the section.
 
 Default = -
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Active if CALD = NO.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
splt - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
splt - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
splt - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
splt - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
splt - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
splt - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
splt - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
splt - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
splt - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
splt - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
splt - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : SPLT   (Section PLoT)
 Category   : plot
 Written    : 1989-01-28   by: Karen Goodger
 Revised    : 2007-01-03   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Plot a section of seismic traces.
 Portability: 32 bit word size
 Parallel   : No
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 
 SPLT is a highly versatile process that produces seismic trace plots on a
 variety of plotting devices.  Because the number of options relating to trace
 plotting are very numerous and the options relating to annotation are even
 more numerous, SPLT is a process for the expert user.  (There are over 170
 parameters.)
 
 Parameters are located in functionally related groups on the parameter entry
 screens; these groups are listed below.  The first group consists of the
 seven essential parameters required to produce a basic plot.  The second
 group consists of basic annotation parameters.  Users with modest
 requirements will not need to visit additional parameter groups.
 
 
 SPLT Parameter Categories
 
   Automatic Annotation Positioning
   Basic Annotation
   Basic Plot
   Block Boundaries and Line-ties
   Graph-style Plots
   Hardcopy Related
   Manual Shotpoint-style Annotation
   Panel and Blank Trace
   Side Label
   Statics Annotation
   Timing Lines
   Trace Appearance
   Trace Selection
   Velocity Functions
 
 
 Length Units
 
 Depending on the choice of English or metric units on the Project_data screen,
 SPLT will automatically use inches or miles where appropriate (English) or
 centimeters or kilometers where appropriate (metric).  Exceptions to this rule
 are documented.  Plotting limitations or restrictions are typically
 documented only in inches.
 
 
 Limitations
 
 Maximum plot length is 240 inches for INDIGO and 200 inches for CGM.  Maximum
 plot height is 30 inches for HP plotters and 35 inches for Indigo and Versatec
 plotters.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
 Basic Plot
 
 Basic plot parameters are those required to produce the simplest plots.
 These parameters are:
 
 TIME      Maximum trace time to plot (time at bottom of plotted trace).
 IPS       Vertical trace scaling - increment (in. or cm) per second.
 TPI       Lateral trace spacing - traces per increment (in. or cm).
 LRRL      Plot traces left to right (LR) or right to left (RL).
 NUM_TR    Maximum number of traces to plot.
 CT        Plotting gain - LAV is plotted as CT channels.
 SID       Plot annotation (Section IDentification).
 
 
 Basic Annotation
 
 Basic annotation parameters are those required for the simplest plot
 annotation.  These parameters are:
 
 CALD      Automatic calculation of annotation location above section.
 
 SCALE     Lateral distance scale marker (mile or kilometer marker).
 
 HDR_LAB(1-4)  Header word to plot as an automatic trace label above section.
 LAB_INIT  Trace number of the first trace label.
 HDR_CHG   Plot automatic trace labels wherever HDR_CHG changes.
 LAB_INC   Trace number increment between trace labels.
 NAM_LAB   Name(s) to identify automatic or manual trace labels.
 LTAB      Plot trace labels on top and bottom of section.
 CS_LAB    Character size for trace label(1-4).
 
 
 OPT_VL    Whether to plot vertical lines, blanks or timing marks under
       labels.
 WID_VL    Width of vertical lines under labels.
 
 AR_BEG    Label for the direction arrow pointing to the start of the plot.
 AR_END    Label for the direction arrow pointing to the end of the plot.
 AR_HT     Height of the direction arrowhead.
 AR_LEN    Length of the direction arrow.
 ARDA      Height of the direction arrow above top of plot.
 
 PATH_ATBM Pathname for file containing the automatic title block master.
 FRTB      Factor for reducing the title block size.
 
 
 Automatic Annotation Location
 
 Setting CALD=YES adjusts parameters SDAS,TIDA,ARDA and SEDA in order to
 prevent annotation from overlapping vertically. This calculation is made at
 workfile building time.

    date        author      description
    ----        ------      -----------
36. 2007-01-03  Stoeckley   Add call to pc_register_array_names for SeisSpace;
                             remove more unused variables.
35. 2006-01-10  B. Menger   Removed Unused Variables.
34. 2003-12-09  Goodger     Set ymax to a maximum of 40 inches. This solves
                            the problem of splt outputting an extra panel.
33. 2003-08-28  Goodger     Doc changes for Houston plotters.
32. 2003-08-14  Goodger     Remove hard coded path.
31. 2002-04-29  k.goodger - Fix overplotting problem with nam_lab parameter.
                            Fix problem cutting off top line of SID.
30. 2002-02-22  k.goodger - Add option to output to a cgm file.  Add plotter
                            HP5000.  Remove indigo and versatec plotters.
29. 2001-12-10  k.goodger - Fix bug in routine tblk (routine that plots the
                            title block) which was causing an internal compiler
                            error on the intel compiler.
                            Take care of warning messages generated by intel
                            compiler.
28. 2001-10-18  k.goodger - Save the unit number for the dplt control cards
                            to insure it is the same for successive splts.
                            Build cards for dplttest if testlib and dplt if
                            prodlib. This change resolves problems with
                            timing lines, when not the first plot.
27. 2001-08-14  k.goodger - Write the plotting scale to the history file,
                            called PLOTSCALE.
26. 2001-08-09  k.goodger - Call new title block routine, ATBLK.
25. 2001-08-02  k.goodger - Fix bug in plbl routine. It was sending a null
                            to the symbol routine.
24. 2001-04-30  k.goodger - Removed check in skip_init trap against num_tr.
23. 2001-03-22  k.goodger - Do not allow a zero time.
22. 2001-02-23  k.goodger - Rename plot files names if jobname is greater
                            than 9 characters.
21. 2001-02-15  k.goodger - Fix bug with dev_loc=SAVE.
20. 2001-02-06  k.goodger - Do not output dplt or spst when opt_loc=test.
                            Fix bug with arrows when conp.
19. 2001-01-24  k.goodger - Add HP and Versatec devices.
18. 2001-01-15  k.goodger - Uppercase tie lines in a file.
17. 2000-12-12  k.goodger - Add printout of title block file.
16. 2000-12-08  k.goodger - Wrapup flag changes.  Added an error flag to
                            splt_vf.
15. 2000-12-05  k.goodger - Print some dplt control card info to online.
14. 2000-12-04  k.goodger - Do not plot minus sign on water depths.  Fix
                            problem with FOLD not coming out on sticker id.
13. 2000-11-30  k.goodger - Removed calles to hist_init and hist_write. This
                            fixes the problem of velocity functions
                            overplotting.
12. 2000-10-31  k.goodger - Remove some repeated code which was causing
                            velocity function failure.
11. 2000-10-27  k.goodger - Add call to ATB.
10. 2000-10-18  k.goodger - If job name is longer than 10 characters, create
                            a random name to use for the plot file rather than
                            the job name.  The vax cannot handle plot file
                            names longer than 10 characters.
                            Fix front end problem.  Variable nsid was not
                            initialized.
09. 2000-09-27  k.goodger - Fix paneling problem when there is only 1 row.
08. 2000-09-18  k.goodger - Correct problem with blank trace traps.
07. 2000-09-18  k.goodger - Fix problem with bthc option.
                            Fix problem with intermediate tic marks not
                            showing up.
                            Implement blank timing lines.
06. 2000-09-14  k.goodger - Correct ovwd parameter to accept decimal.
                            Convert scale parameter to upper case.
                            Convert side labels to upper case.

                            Change VINT OR&I to ORI.
                            Correct problems with more than 1 plot in a job.

05. 2000-09-12  k.goodger - Print error message if velocity funcion headers

04. 2000-09-11  k.goodger - Remove and old array which was not allocated
